headline: Private equity associate
pros:
- great culture, especially in the sharky world of private equity funds. this place is mostly filled with very smart, nice people who will vouch for you
- respect for work/life balance. Of course in crunch times you are expected to step up but that is private equity
cons:
- in the last years they have started becoming more of a bulge bracket and less of a growth equity fund, and lost their edge especially in the exciting technology / growth plays because of their minimum $100m equity check requirement (which is really more like $200-$300 now)
- very difficult to get promoted from associate all the way up, but again that is true at most funds

headline: Best place to work on the industry...
pros: Culture is awesome.  Great work atmosphere. Flat organization, encourages all team members to speak up and be heard.  Deal team works really well with management teams of portfolio companies. Senior  folks don't take themselves too seriously.  Humble, listen to operating partners, CEOs, investors. Investment track record is second to none.  Totally aligned with fund investors.
cons: People at Advent are super committed to their work, and to their portfolio companies.  Better work life balance than most firms but the industry is demanding and not for everyone.
